abstract: Elite American prep schools respond to series of sexual abuse allegations with firings and increase in programs and policies aimed at prevention; experts suggest boarding school culture and constant physical proximity between students and faculty at such institutions are conducive to abuse.
lead_paragraph: Phillips Exeter Academy in New Hampshire fired two teachers over sexual misconduct. As more cases come to light, schools are changing how they handle abuse.

headline.main: Prep Schools Wrestle With Sex Abuse Accusations Against Teachers
